sen.j: 加えて、仏教を専修念仏を行う浄土門とそれ以外の行を行う聖道門に分け、浄土門を娑婆世界を厭い極楽往生を願って専修念仏を行う門、聖道門を現世で修行を行い悟りを目指す門と規定している。
sen.e: In addition, he divided Buddhism into Gateway of the Pure Land that practices senju-nembutsu and Gateway of the Holy Path that uses other practices, and he prescribed the Gateway of the Pure Land as the gateway by which one engages in senju-nembutsu with a wish to escape the humanly world and to be born in the Pure Land, and the Gateway of the Holy Path as the gateway by which one aims for enlightenment by training in this world.
sen.cmt: 浄土門 = Jodo-mon (Gateway of the Pure Land), 聖道門 = Shodo-mon (Gateway of the Holy Path), 出典すべてhttp://www.jodo.org/terminology/japanese.html
sen.e: In addition, he divided Buddhism into Gateway of the Pure Land that practices senju-nembutsu and Gateway of the Holy Path that uses other practices, and he prescribed the Gateway of the Pure Land as the gateway by which one engages in senju-nembutsu with a wish to escape the humanly world and to be born in the Pure Land, and the Gateway of the Holy Path as the gateway by which one aims for enlightenment by training in this world.

In addition, he divided Buddhism into Gateway of the Pure Land that practices senju-nenbutsu and Gateway of the Holy Path that uses other practices, and he prescribed the Gateway of the Pure Land as the gateway by which one engages in senju-nenbutsu with a wish to escape the humanly world and to be born in the Pure Land, and the Gateway of the Holy Path as the gateway by which one aims for enlightenment by training in this world.

sen.e: The Three Minds are: "Utterly Sincere Mind", "Profound Mind" and "Eko-hotsugan shin (Mind which Dedicates One's Merit to the Pure Land with the Resolution to Be Born There)".

sen.e: He stated that there is no difference between the daily recitation of nembutsu and the recitation of nembutsu at one's last moments, and he commented that all there is to it is that as one nears death the daily nembutsu recitation becomes the last nembutsu recitation.

sen.j: 自力は聖人にしか行えないもので千人に一人、万人に一人二人救われるかどうかだとし、対して他力の念仏は、名を称えた者を救うという阿弥陀仏の四十八願を根拠として必ず阿弥陀仏が救いとってくださるとしている。
sen.e: Self Power can only be accomplished by sacred beings so that only one in a thousand or one or two in ten thousand may be delivered, but through nembutsu by Other Power, on the other hand, Amitaba Buddha will deliver us based on Amida Buddha's Forty-Eight Vows which states that he will deliver anyone who calls his name. Therefore, he stated that one should practice nembutsu with the Three Minds.
